9   COMMENT EMAIL MORE Mark Grace is returning to Arizona Diamondbacks television.
The former Diamondbacks player, who has also served as a coach in the organization and a television analyst for the team, is joining Fox Sports Arizona as the network's "D-backs Live" pre and post game show analyst, the station announced Wednesday.
From 2004-12, Grace was the Diamondbacks television analyst. He worked with play-by-play announcers Thom Brennaman and Daron Sutton.
RELATED: Mark Grace hired for TV role with 'organization I really love' 
ON FACEBOOK: Give us your reaction to Mark Grace returning to D-Backs TV 
Grace was fired from the broadcast booth in 2012 after a second DUI arrest. He coached in the Diamondbacks organization for the past three seasons.
He was the Diamondbacks assistant hitting coach the past two years.
We asked for your reaction to Grace's return to TV with the Diamondbacks and you responded on social media.
Excited to see Mark Grace back on #Dbacks TV? Give us your reaction here: https://t.co/qN5T2qlXWT pic.twitter.com/XorK5Yv9Mo 
‚Äî azcentral sports (@azcsports) February 15, 2017 A sampling of what you're saying about Grace's return to Diamondbacks TV: Lonnie Clardy (on Facebook): "I have always liked Mark Grace, he always brought good stuff to the telecast before he lost that position. I continue to hope that his past issues are behind him and I'm thankful that he is getting another shot."
@azcsports Gracie is great on TV!!
‚Äî ArizonaHiggins (@ArizonaHiggins) February 15, 2017 Pete Rios (on Facebook): "Mark made a bad choice and he suffered the consequences. Now he's paid his dues, taken care of his issues and is given a second chance with a lesson learned.. Floyd on the other hand gets a Super Bowl ring, gets cocky about it.. feels he deserved it.. throws it in the Cardinals face and believes bad decisions come with a reward..
Good to see you back Grace."
@azcsports Hell yeah, bet he takes Uber now
‚Äî Chad Calderone (@thefolksathome) February 15, 2017 Elliott Dalton (on Facebook): "Thank you! DBacks are definately back on my priority list, love Gracie and his on air flair! "Like that on lady in Houston!". Adds life to the broadcast for sure...I've got a great feeling about this season."
@azcsports @azcentral Good üëçüèº
‚Äî Humberto Delgado (@HumeTheGreat69) February 15, 2017 Vicki Krane Sowards (on Facebook): "He has been "graceful" and has shown the quality person he is...he made a mistake and made no excuses in accepting his punishment. Sports figures have done worse things and never accepted responsibility for their actions."
@azcsports This is great!
‚Äî Paul Jenkins (@realcoachpaul) February 15, 2017 Steve Sichrovsky (on Facebook): "They have bigger problems. How about a competitive team? Yeah, let's start there. It's easy to analyze a team that sucks."
#Dbacks Mark Grace is back ... as pre- and post-game TV analyst. It should be fun and informative.
‚Äî Jack Magruder (@JackMagruder) February 15, 2017 Kath De Anda (on Facebook): "Like Gracie but did not like all the ridiculous non-baseball yakking he and Sutton were so fond of. So please stick to baseball facts and stats and we'll be good to go!"
Looking forward to working with the one and only Mark Grace on @FOXSPORTSAZ this season! pic.twitter.com/tjYiTY3skK 
‚Äî Jody Jackson (@Jody_Jackson) February 15, 2017 Ken Miller (on Facebook): "Sure. He paid his debt. Knows the game extremely well and he's funny welcome back"
@azcsports @nickpiecoro @azcentral Shots fired at the Cubs
‚Äî #LGY (@OEL_MVP) February 15, 2017 Scott Somers (on Facebook): "As long as he doesn't broadcast from Chase Field. The place is dilapidated and dangerous. Just ask the D-backs."
Mark Grace is back!! Happy Dance! https://t.co/KkDFxdzLxp 
‚Äî Melissa B. (@Melizard21) February 15, 2017 Andrew Williams (on Facebook): "I hate this idea he was never good at being on tv he was very boring"
MORE: Where are D-Backs in power rankings? | How many wins for D-Backs? 
Grace is scheduled to make his debut on Friday, March 31. The Diamondbacks host the Cleveland Indians at Chase Field in their final spring training game that night. TV coverage is scheduled to begin at 6 p.m. on Fox Sports Arizona Plus.
Grace will team with hosts Todd Walsh and Jody Jackson and analyst Brandon Webb on the pre and post game shows.
Steve Berthiaume is the D-Backs' play-by-play announcer and Bob Brenly is the color analyst.
Grace played 16 years in the major leagues. He was a member of the Diamondbacks 2001 World Series team and spent three seasons with the team.
What's your reaction to Mark Grace returning to Diamondbacks television? Join the conversation on Facebook . 
For more from The Heat Index, go to heatindex.azcentral.com .
